column4: How do you install the c, c++, and ruby libraries? Also, does this support pthreads?
build-essentials, has gcc and g++
what's the command? I'm too windowsized lately :(
sudo aptitude install build-essential, installs gcc and g++ required to compile c and c++ programs
Among other programs
g++ or .cpp files
for*
can you do: locate pthread.h
there is no return to the statement when I type it in terminal, just the next prompt
That means you don't have pthread, wait let me search which packages offers it
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=659279 suggests you need to install glibc
sudo apt-get install glibc ?? it said couldn't find glibc
Do a, sudo aptitude search glibc, and tell me which packages you get
umm, don't sudo that, just aptitude search glibc
ok, sudo aptitude install glibc worked. Afterwards, I tried to g++ again and still doesn't know of pthread
What version of ubuntu are you on?
in c++, I just include <iostream> so I just <pthread> but do I have to <pthread.h> instead?
Ubuntu 8.04
I don't know. Haven't worked with pthreads
Are you have glibc package? :S Weird... are you sure it insatlled it?
Yeah, I installed. I just put .h and it compiled fine...I'm going to make sure the functions work fine. Silly  mistakes
No problems. Thats what I am here for :P
